title: Tracking Issue for Generator Memory Usage

labels.name: metabug
labels.description: Issues about issues themselves ("bugs about bugs")

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: I-heavy
labels.description: Problems and improvements with respect to binary size of generated code.

labels.name: AsyncAwait-Triaged
labels.description: Async-await issues that have been triaged during a working group meeting.

body:
(old issue: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/52924)

This issue tracks ideas for reducing the memory footprint of generators.

* [ ] https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/59087 – Generator size: borrowed variables are assumed live across following yield points
* [ ] https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/62321 – `size_of_val` in a generator can make the generator bigger
* [ ] https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/62575 – Better greedy layout computation for generators
* [ ] https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/62952 – Copy trait defeats generator optimization
* [ ] https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/62958 – Async fn doubles argument size
* [x] https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/66100 – [codegen] Unnecessary panicking branches in resumption of infinite generator (stored in static variable)
* [x] https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/69815 – Generators should use smaller discriminants

Note that this issue is different from https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/69663, which tracks typesystem-level improvements regarding generators. This issue is purely about the code generation aspect.
